title: Nevada man charged with hate crime after 'hanging tree' comment at car show
content: Three individuals were arrested in Nevada after a confrontation with a Black man collecting signatures, during which a 'hanging tree' was mentioned. Gary Miller, 74, his wife, and daughter face multiple misdemeanor charges. The incident, recorded during a Virginia City car show, led to backlash. Nevada Attorney General Aaron Ford praised the arrests.
summary: Three individuals were arrested in Nevada after a confrontation with a Black man collecting signatures, during which a 'hanging tree' was mentioned. Gary Miller, 74, his wife, and daughter face multiple misdemeanor charges. The incident, recorded during a Virginia City car show, led to backlash. Nevada Attorney General Aaron Ford praised the arrests.

title: Huge California wildfire chews through timber in very hot and dry weather
content: California's largest wildfire of the year, the Park Fire, grew rapidly due to hot and dry weather, burning over 660 square miles since July 24. Containment remained at 34%, and authorities focused on curtailing spot fires. A man was arrested for allegedly starting the fire, which destroyed hundreds of structures.
summary: California's largest wildfire of the year, the Park Fire, grew rapidly due to hot and dry weather, burning over 660 square miles since July 24. Containment remained at 34%, and authorities focused on curtailing spot fires. A man was arrested for allegedly starting the fire, which destroyed hundreds of structures.

title: 'Meghan Markle allegedly screaming after CBS interview': Duchess of Sussex faces fresh controversy over tense TV appearance with Prince Harry
content: After their recent interview, Meghan Markle reportedly had a 'meltdown,' being very upset and angry about unexpected questions regarding her suicidal thoughts. Experts noted visible tension between Meghan and Prince Harry, describing the interview as a 'car crash' due to their awkward dynamics and Meghan's frustration with the producers and her husband's responses.
summary: After their recent interview, Meghan Markle reportedly had a 'meltdown,' being very upset and angry about unexpected questions regarding her suicidal thoughts. Experts noted visible tension between Meghan and Prince Harry, describing the interview as a 'car crash' due to their awkward dynamics and Meghan's frustration with the producers and her husband's responses.

title: The world's most dangerous volcanoes: Waiting for the next eruption
content: The article investigates the world's most dangerous volcanoes, highlighting their historical eruptions and current threats. Notable mentions include Mount Vesuvius, Mount St. Helens, and Mount Merapi, among others. Each poses significant risks to nearby populations, with ongoing monitoring due to their potential for future eruptions

title: 'JD Vance is not authentic': Former White house press secretary Jen Psaki slams Republican US VP nominee saying 'voters are not dumb'
content: Jen Psaki criticized Republican VP nominee JD Vance for inauthenticity, noting his shift to support Donald Trump. Psaki emphasized Vance's inconsistency, stating voters are smart enough to notice. Recently, Vance's attempt to confront Kamala Harris further highlighted his campaign tactics. Trump announced Vance as his VP pick in July via Truth Social.
summary: Jen Psaki criticized Republican VP nominee JD Vance for inauthenticity, noting his shift to support Donald Trump. Psaki emphasized Vance's inconsistency, stating voters are smart enough to notice. Recently, Vance's attempt to confront Kamala Harris further highlighted his campaign tactics. Trump announced Vance as his VP pick in July via Truth Social.

title: US elections: Trump's 'Criminals for Kamala' video sparks controversy amid his own legal troubles
Canadian man sues TikTok, Instagram, Facebook for ‘addictive’ design, citing harm to mental health
content: A 24-year-old Canadian man launched a lawsuit against TikTok, YouTube, Reddit, Instagram, and Facebook, claiming they create platforms that are too addictive. Represented by Lambert Avocats, he says social media has hurt his productivity and sleep since 2015. The lawsuit seeks compensatory and punitive damages, arguing the companies were negligent in their app design.
summary: A 24-year-old Canadian man launched a lawsuit against TikTok, YouTube, Reddit, Instagram, and Facebook, claiming they create platforms that are too addictive. Represented by Lambert Avocats, he says social media has hurt his productivity and sleep since 2015. The lawsuit seeks compensatory and punitive damages, arguing the companies were negligent in their app design.

title: ‘What am I doing?’: Biden appears confused at White House event honoring Texas Rangers; watch video
Japan's scientists warn of a 'megaquake': What it means
content: Japan's earthquake scientists warned of a potential 'megaquake' in the future, which could cause massive loss of life. The Japan Meteorological Association issued this advisory under new guidelines post the 2011 disasters, cautioning about strong shaking and large tsunamis from the Nankai Trough, a significant subduction zone with past destructive quakes.
summary: Japan's earthquake scientists warned of a potential 'megaquake' in the future, which could cause massive loss of life. The Japan Meteorological Association issued this advisory under new guidelines post the 2011 disasters, cautioning about strong shaking and large tsunamis from the Nankai Trough, a significant subduction zone with past destructive quakes.

title: US elections: First live debate between Harris and Trump announced - Key details
content: US vice presidential candidate Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump faced off in their first live television debate on September 10. This followed Joe Biden’s withdrawal from the race after a dominant Trump performance in their June debate. Recent polls showed Harris leading Trump, boosted by her campaign's nomination of Tim Walz as her running mate.
summary: US vice presidential candidate Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump faced off in their first live television debate on September 10. This followed Joe Biden’s withdrawal from the race after a dominant Trump performance in their June debate. Recent polls showed Harris leading Trump, boosted by her campaign's nomination of Tim Walz as her running mate.

title: 'I have always been ... ': Usha Vance reveals truth behind JD Vance’s eyeliner speculation
content: Usha Vance, wife of the Republican vice-presidential candidate, clarified the speculation around her husband's notable lashes and striking eyes, confirming they are natural and untouched by cosmetics. Even Donald Trump noticed and praised Vance's appearance. A report from Puck News had previously suggested that his prominent lash line was likely natural.
summary: Usha Vance, wife of the Republican vice-presidential candidate, clarified the speculation around her husband's notable lashes and striking eyes, confirming they are natural and untouched by cosmetics. Even Donald Trump noticed and praised Vance's appearance. A report from Puck News had previously suggested that his prominent lash line was likely natural.

title: Renowned crocodile expert Adam Britton jailed for sexually abusing dogs
US election: Trump’s 2020 praise for Walz's response to Minneapolis riots collides with current criticism
Russia accuses UK of instigating and taking part in Ukraine's 'major provocation'
content: Russia accused the UK of involvement in Ukraine's attack on Russia's Kursk region. Kyiv's troops, equipped with Western tanks, attacked Russia's Kursk to divert Russian forces. Russia claimed it halted the advance, causing heavy casualties. Recent offensive into Russian territory seems to be carried out by a substantial force of several thousand Ukrainian soldiers. The US approved the operation, citing defensive capabilities against imminent Russian attacks.
summary: Russia accused the UK of involvement in Ukraine's attack on Russia's Kursk region. Kyiv's troops, equipped with Western tanks, attacked Russia's Kursk to divert Russian forces. Russia claimed it halted the advance, causing heavy casualties. Recent offensive into Russian territory seems to be carried out by a substantial force of several thousand Ukrainian soldiers. The US approved the operation, citing defensive capabilities against imminent Russian attacks.

title: Tropical storm Debby’s fury: Tornadoes and floods impact homes, schools, and lives
content: Tornadoes generated by Tropical Storm Debby caused destruction in North and South Carolina, damaging homes and infrastructure, including Springfield Middle School. One fatality was reported in Lucama, North Carolina. The storm led to significant flooding in both Carolinas and southeastern Georgia. With Debby downgraded to a tropical depression, further rains and flooding were anticipated in the region.
summary: Tornadoes generated by Tropical Storm Debby caused destruction in North and South Carolina, damaging homes and infrastructure, including Springfield Middle School. One fatality was reported in Lucama, North Carolina. The storm led to significant flooding in both Carolinas and southeastern Georgia. With Debby downgraded to a tropical depression, further rains and flooding were anticipated in the region.

title: Hall of Fame golfer Juan 'Chi Chi' Rodriguez passes away at 88
Ukraine launches unexpected attack inside Russia, shakes up 30-month war in bold move
content: Ukrainian forces launched an unexpected attack into Russian territory, surprising Moscow and opening a new front in the conflict. The incursion, involving about 1,000 Ukrainian soldiers, aimed to divert Russian resources and alleviate pressure on Ukrainian forces in the east. Russian officials reported several settlements were seized, prompting a state of emergency in one region.
summary: Ukrainian forces launched an unexpected attack into Russian territory, surprising Moscow and opening a new front in the conflict. The incursion, involving about 1,000 Ukrainian soldiers, aimed to divert Russian resources and alleviate pressure on Ukrainian forces in the east. Russian officials reported several settlements were seized, prompting a state of emergency in one region.

title: Teen loses life after dairy allergy reaction to Costa Coffee hot chocolate
Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro signs decree blocking X access for 10 days
content: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has blocked access to social media platform X for 10 days following a disputed election. Maduro, accusing Elon Musk of inciting unrest, signed a resolution presented by Conatel. Opposition leaders claim the election was fraudulent, leading to protests and calls from international bodies for transparency, while security forces cracked down on demonstrators.
summary: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has blocked access to social media platform X for 10 days following a disputed election. Maduro, accusing Elon Musk of inciting unrest, signed a resolution presented by Conatel. Opposition leaders claim the election was fraudulent, leading to protests and calls from international bodies for transparency, while security forces cracked down on demonstrators.

title: Harris doesn't back Israel arms embargo, aide says
content: Kamala Harris's aide clarified that she does not support an arms embargo on Israel, emphasizing her commitment to ensuring Israel's defense. This stance comes amid pressure from the Democratic left and in the context of her recent interactions with pro-Palestinian protesters. Harris’s position is critical in the battleground state of Michigan, where many oppose the Gaza war.
summary: Kamala Harris's aide clarified that she does not support an arms embargo on Israel, emphasizing her commitment to ensuring Israel's defense. This stance comes amid pressure from the Democratic left and in the context of her recent interactions with pro-Palestinian protesters. Harris’s position is critical in the battleground state of Michigan, where many oppose the Gaza war.
